comment: A discord bot token from the developer portal
The name of the server the bot is running on (used for welcome messages)
The prefix before commands, so if it was !, then all commands would
need to be used with a ! beforehand, so !complain, !matchmake, etc.
The id of the admin to contact, you can get this by running the bot without it
Then mentioning the admin you want to put in and then grabbing the number that shows up
So @someone would show up something like <@000000000000000000>,
the zeros being the number you would put in below
Self explanatory, should be a no usage and time limit invite link

presence.comment: This module gives the bot a discord presence
The type of presence, this should just be a number (expirement with it to see the different types)
The contents of the presence, self-explainatory

comment: Configures database for usage in bio and database roles if enabled

assignedroles.comment: Tells the bot if you want this module enabled or not
Tells the bot if you want to assign roles through the database or in the JSON
If 'db' is set to false, this is how you configure roles in JSON mode
Put anyones name+id or user id (user id is the better option) in and a list of roles and it'll auto assign it
Specifically on join, and when they use the command
Bot wipes all roles if matchmaking is enabled, so this
is needed if you want any form of enforced roles

bio.comment: This is the bio module, it sets and gives back user-set bio's, redis is required for this one
For example, !bio set hello -> Saved, !bio show @person -> hello
Tells the bot if you want this module enabled or not

complaints.comment: This module sends complaints to a channel
And deletes the message where the complaint was sent
Tells the bot if you want this module enabled or not
Where to send complaints when a member types !complain

mee6.comment: If you have MEE6 on your server,
and use it's level system, this gets around
potential conflicts with the bot's matchmaking system
by having the bot assign them itself
Tells the bot if you want this module enabled or not
A level notification channel is required
The threshold level to assign a role at (currently only one potential threshold)
What role to assign at that level

reactionlimits.comment: WARNING: This module is currently expiremental and will be expanded in the future,
This module limits reactions on a specififed message,
When this module detects more than n reactions on a message by one user
It removes all of their reactions

admin-elections.comment: The channel ID of the message
The amount to limit each user's reactions to

matchmaking.comment: This module asks questions and assigns roles based on the answers
Tells the bot if you want this module enabled or not
What role to give people upon join
What role to give people when they recieve a text question
Where to ask people questions for role assignment

questions.comment: The key below is not shown to the user and is just in the JSON
so don't worry about what it says, it's not a title

unicoderolequestion.comment: This is the question that will be asked
unicoderolequestion.question: Example Question
unicoderolequestion.comment: There are two types of questions, role and action questions,
action is pretty much just used as a continue or stop and will
be talked about later, role is used to assign roles, of course
This specifies how many options can be picked in a question,
basically, is this a checkbox question where multiple can be picked
or is this a multiple choice question where only one can be picked
The bot can use both normal and custom emojis, unicode means you'd like
to use normal emojis, so you can put just any standard emoji in,
while custom is just server emojis if you'd like to add your own
These are the possible answers the user can respond with
Of course, the bot will respond with these before hand,
in order to make sure the user knows which ones it needs
Now, the location of the possible answers and the roles below
need to match up, so for example if the user above responds with
a thumbs up, since it's the first item in that list,
It'll assign them the first item in this list below
So the answers should always match up (locationally) with the roles

customrolequestion.question: Example Question 2
customrolequestion.comment: Now instead of emojis, you just put in the custom emoji's name
So for example if I had one that was called test, and you
would just generally use it in the server as :test:,
you would just simply type in test, so no colon

actionquestion.question: Do you want to continue?
actionquestion.comment: Now, close just means to stop all the questions and finish, while nothing
just means to continue, this is useful if you want to ask a set of follow up questions,
Like, are you intrested in this? If no, close, if yes, put an empty string,
then the later questions can ask for more info

hybridquestion.question: Example 3
hybridquestion.comment: Hybrid allows you to have one answer result in one action and another something else,
so for example, if you answer yes, it can give you a role, but if you answer no,
it can run an action, in this list, you assign the actions to their type, in the
same organization methodology as the answers and actions lists
Now, close just means to stop all the questions and finish, while nothing
just means to continue, this is useful if you want to ask a set of follow up questions,
Like, are you intrested in this? If no, close, if yes, put an empty string,
then the later questions can ask for more info

gotoquestion.question: Do you want to continue?
gotoquestion.comment: Now a goto action, in order to use a goto, you type in 'goto' and then follow that by
question name, so for example, if this was a different question and I wanted to go to this one,
I would type in 'goto gotoquestion' and it would skip ahead to that

checklistquestion.question: Example Question 5000.23
checklistquestion.comment: This is different, basically, now instead of just reacting with the emojis in the 'answers' list,
it will react with an additional checkmark at the end, so that users can pick as many options
from the answers list and then hit the checkmark when done in order to assign a large

autosubmitquestions.comment: Title says all. Questions that immediently submit when reached

textquestion.question: Pick an option
textquestion.comment: Below you can put a list of answers that the bot will prompt for
Now while roles can be used the exact same way here as above, (align the role with the answer's index)
theres a more compact way to use it, in case the role names exactly match the answers,
so by using 0 in roles, it'll just assign roles from the answers, so for example in this case,
if someone were to pick test3, it would assign the role test3 without needing to duplicate it below

questions.comment: Now I've mainly used these role assignments to:
A. Create private channels that people can get assigned to based on their intrests
B. Create some sort of role that people can @ to ask them questions about the topic their role is setup for
C. Create seperated areas on the member list, based off of peoples opinions and intrests
But thats just some ideas, theres plenty of other things you can do
